intro: Strobilanthes reptans, commonly known as the creeping strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique flowering pattern, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
